intro: Crematomia elongata, commonly known as the elongated cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typical of the mustard family. Its flowers are followed by rounded, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Crematomia elongata is typically found in moist, temperate environments and is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
